title: Adelaide truckie charged over bizarre road rage attack on Portrush Rd, Marryatville
text:
A TRUCK driver will face court on Monday charged over a bizarre road rage incident on one of Adelaide’s busiest roads, during which he allegedly rammed and then drove over another car.

Authorities were called to the southbound carriageway of Portrush Road, Marryatville, in the inner eastern suburbs, at 8.50am on Saturday amid reports of an “altercation”.

Police will allege the truck had “rammed” the vehicle before the driver, 43, of North Haven, in the Adelaide’s west, got out and became embroiled in a row with the motorist driving a small hatchback.

During the fight the truck driver, who has not been identified, then allgedly “assaulted” the unnamed motorist.

Police allege that when witnesses intervened the truck driver then “got back in his vehicle and reversed over the hatchback, causing significant damage” before driving off.

It remains unclear what triggered the bizarre road rage attack, just before the Kensington Rd intersection and which was witnessed by “numerous” people.

No one was injured during the incident on the main truck corridor between the northern suburbs and the South Eastern Freeway to Melbourne.

The area is also close to Loreto College and the popular Robin Hood hotel.

Eastern Adelaide CIB detectives on Sunday arrested the truck driver and charged him with acts to endanger life, driving in a dangerous manner, assault and other unspecified traffic offences.

He remains in custody after being refused police bail and will appear in the Adelaide Magistrates Court on Monday.

Police urged any witnesses who have not yet spoken to detectives to provide their details via Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or online at crimestopperssa.com.au.
